titleStmt.title: Englands intrest [sic] in securing the woollen-manufacture, of this realm Against the artiffices, and designs of France, asserted and made evident to all true lovers of their country. To which is added a reply to some objections formerly made to the same subject.
Englands glory
titleStmt.author: Carter, W. (William)

titleStmt.title: Englands intrest [sic] in securing the woollen-manufacture, of this realm Against the artiffices, and designs of France, asserted and made evident to all true lovers of their country. To which is added a reply to some objections formerly made to the same subject.
Englands glory
titleStmt.author: Carter, W. (William)
Carter, W. (William). Reply to a paper intituled, Reasons for a limited exportation of wooll.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by Joseph Streater, for the author,

notesStmt.note: Originally published in 1669 as: Englands glory
"A reply to a paper intituled, Reasons for a limited exportation of wooll" (caption title) has separate pagination; register is continuous.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
